result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamal J Jamerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

Total fine and costs to be paid during the term of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Forfeit Firearm used in the offense - FN Herschal model handgun.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamal J Jamerson

records.addlTxt: 2:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jamal J Jamerson in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Jamal J Jamerson.   Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the Defendant guilty as to their plea.  State as to sentencing.  Counsel as to sentencing.  Statements by Defendant.  Court renders judgment.

2:05 PM Matter set for plea/sentencing.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jamal J Jamerson in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Jamal J Jamerson.  Discovery has been received. Pretrial is set for 6/27/22.  Counsel request new date. If matter is not resolved by next hearing, trial date will be set.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on July 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol with Maria Penkwitz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jamal J Jamerson appeared in court, Attorney Christopher Scott Carson for Jamal J Jamerson appeared in court.  Case will be resolved but awaiting test results.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bond posted at Sheriff's Office on 1/1/2022.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Not to possess firearms.  Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.  All prescriptions are to remain in original container. Pretrial to be conducted before next hearing.  State is awaiting blood results.

8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jamal J Jamerson appeared in court, Attorney Christopher Scott Carson appeared in court, via Zoom video conferencing for Jamal J Jamerson. Counsel waives reading and enters a not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause.
Further proceedings scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on March 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Court will allow Atty Carson to appear via zoom for tomorrow's hearing. Clerk emailed counsel Zoom info and advised his client is to appear in person.
to Appear by Zoom.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
